intro: Thesium corymbuligerum, commonly known as the clustered thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a rosette at the base. Thesium corymbuligerum is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
